Literature Review: Recent advances in causal inference and machine learning have revolutionized the field of sociology, enabling researchers to better understand complex social phenomena. This literature review focuses on four broad topics: causal effect identification and estimation, causal effect heterogeneity, causal effect mediation, and temporal and spatial interference. We explore how machine learning can be effectively combined with causal inference to address potential biases and uncover heterogeneous causal effects.
